channel.title: Employments on Jackson Campolattaro
channel.description: Recent content in Employments on Jackson Campolattaro

item.title: SIMD
item.description: I enjoyed my time building an Octree for CGAL, and I was interested in continuing the same type of work. After the end of the summer I kept in touch with my mentor, and he put me in contact with his colleagues at Inria. Once I knew I would be attending graduate school in Europe we made arrangements for in-person work at Inria’s research campus in Sophia Antipolis, France.

item.title: Orthtree
item.description: Over the summer of 2020 I participated in Google’s Summer of Code program, which pairs students with open source projects. Because of my N-Body project I was familiar with tree-based algorithms, so I was drawn to CGAL’s proposed Octree project. I was paired with Simon Giraudot and worked remotely, corresponding by daily email and regular calls. The boxes of an orthtree (black) produced by a point cloud (blue) The goal of the project was to create a new CGAL package which provides an Octree data structure.

item.title: Inria SIMD Blog
item.description: Note: This page is mirrored from my page on CGAL's internal wiki, apologies for any incorrect formatting.
